channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Businesses cautiously optimistic about level 1
item.description: Talk of returning the country to a "new normal" has been welcomed with cautious optimism, but those who are eagerly awaiting a change warn the devil is in the detail.

item.title: No doubt racism exists in New Zealand Police - Māori law expert
item.description: Claims that New Zealand police are not racist are refuted by the evidence, Māori associate professor of law Khylee Quince says.

item.title: Photo essay: Offshore Nelson island focus of community restoration programme
item.description: It is one of New Zealand's smallest islands, but still large enough to host a range of pests and rodents.

item.title: Christchurch Black Lives Matter protest organiser stands firm
item.description: An organiser of the Black Lives Matter protest in Christchurch is standing by his decision to help create the event, despite social distancing rules not being followed.

item.title: Auckland teen leaves school after blackface selfie investigation
item.description: A student who posed in blackface for a Snapchat photo has left Auckland's Westlake Girls High School, the college has confirmed.

item.title: Government reveals free trades training for next 2.5 years
item.description: Courses and training in construction, agriculture and community work will be free for the next two-and-a-half years, Jacinda Ardern and Chris Hipkins have announced.

item.title: Rental market demand soars as Covid-19 forces NZers home
item.description: Covid-19 adds further pressure to some cities already struggling with squeezed rental property markets, as the number of vulnerable people unable to afford housing also rises.

item.title: Auckland CBD speed limits to drop
item.description: Several roads in Auckland's city centre will have their speed limits lowered to 30km/h later this month.

item.title: Coromandel residents, businesses clean up after heavy rain damage
item.description: Campers, trampers and Coromandel residents were all wringing out their mops today after a deluge of prolonged heavy rain over the long weekend.

item.title: Traffic light glitch, poor driver behaviour blamed for Awakino gridlock
item.description: A short phasing traffic light at road works is being blamed for holding up hundreds of holidaymakers in gridlock in the Awakino Gorge on State Highway 3 in Taranaki yesterday.

item.title: Queenstown community hub opens Thursday
item.description: The Kia Kaha Queenstown Lakes Community Hub will open its doors to the community on Thursday.

item.title: New speed limits in Bay of Plenty to come into force end of June
item.description: Speed limits on State Highway 33 and State Highway 30 in Bay of Plenty will be reduced.

item.title: Covid-19 developments in NZ and globally for 2 June
item.description: The Prime Minister says she will outline what alert level 1 will look like later this week. Read back through RNZ's live updates on Covid-19 for 2 June.

item.title: Hidden transmission of Covid-19 still possible in NZ - expert
item.description: Hidden transmission of the Covid-19 coronavirus in New Zealand has not been ruled out, a member of the government's modelling team says.

item.title: Consents for new homes fell steeply during lockdown
item.description: Consents for new homes have fallen and the value of non-residential building consents has dropped steeply, Statistics New Zealand says.

item.title: Vessels barred from repairs in New Zealand costing jobs, Aimex warns
item.description: Banning overseas vessels from entering Nelson's port is costing jobs and millions of dollars in work, the head of a marine engineering firm says.

item.title: Shooting in Auckland yesterday investigated as homicide - police
item.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation after a man was found dead in Grafton yesterday.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 for 11th day - Ministry of Health
item.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield urged people to take care at gatherings recognising the US death of George Floyd, on the 11th day of no new Covid-19 cases.
